md:
giải nghĩa từ "achy" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

### Achy

* Adjective
	+ (of a part of the body) feeling a dull pain or discomfort
		- Ví dụ: "I've got an achy back from lifting heavy boxes all day."
	+ (of a feeling or mood) uncomfortable or unhappy
		- Ví dụ: "I've been feeling achy and restless all week, I need a break."
* Từ liên quan: sore, painful, uncomfortable, unhappy
* Từ trái nghĩa: comfortable, happy, painless

### Note

* Achy is often used to describe a dull, persistent pain or discomfort, rather than a sharp or sudden pain.
* It can also be used to describe a feeling or mood that is uncomfortable or unhappy, rather than a physical sensation.

Achy

  • Adjective

      • Ví dụ: "I've got an achy back from lifting heavy boxes all day."
    • (of a feeling or mood) uncomfortable or unhappy
      • Ví dụ: "I've been feeling achy and restless all week, I need a break."
  • Từ liên quan: sore, painful, uncomfortable, unhappy
  • Từ trái nghĩa: comfortable, happy, painless

Note

  • Achy is often used to describe a dull, persistent pain or discomfort, rather than a sharp or sudden pain.
  • It can also be used to describe a feeling or mood that is uncomfortable or unhappy, rather than a physical sensation.
